medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, chills, low blood pressure, and painful swelling of the left lower leg.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms developed within a 24-hour period after the patient waded in brackish water and experienced multiple fire-ant stings. Symptoms intensified with fever rising to 39.8°C and rapid progression of hemorrhagic cellulitis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 20-year history of excessive alcohol consumption and recent abdominal sonography revealing parenchymal liver disease with fatty change compatible with alcoholic liver disease.
medical_history.social_history: Excessive alcohol consumption (∼20 g of ethanol per day) and exposure to contaminated brackish water.
